channel.title: Slice of SciFi: Sirius-XM Radio Show, Online Edition
channel.description: News and interviews around the world of science fiction TV, movies and more from Michael, Brian, Sam, Summer and the news team. If it's on TV or in the movies, and has spaceships, long swords, vampires or zombies, we are probably talking about it!
channel.managingEditor: summer@sliceofscifi.com (Michael, Brian, Sam and a cast of dozens)
channel.webMaster: summer@sliceofscifi.com (Michael, Brian, Sam and a cast of dozens)
channel.itunes:subtitle: News you crave about science fiction in television and film, plus coverage of comics, independent features, and science with interviews and much more
channel.itunes:summary: Science Fiction TV & Movie News, Interviews & more: News about science fiction TV, movies and more from Michael, Brian, Sam, Summer and the news team. If it's on TV or in the movies, and has spaceships, long swords, vampires or zombies, we are probably talking about it!
channel.itunes:keywords: scifi, fantasy, horror, television, movies, comics, science
channel.itunes:author: Michael, Brian, Sam and a cast of dozens

itunes:owner.itunes:name: Michael, Brian, Sam and a cast of dozens

channel.feedburner:browserFriendly: You clicked the link, didn't you? You weren't supposed to do that. Fine. I'm hiding the ugly XML. Try subscribing next time.

item.title: Slice of SciFi #462: Exclusive "Eureka" Roundtable with series creator Jamie Paglia, stars Colin Ferguson, Salli Richardson-Whitfield and Debrah Farentino
item.dc:creator: Michael Hickerson
item.description: If you're a fan of Eureka, you don't want to miss today's installment of Slice! Brian and Sam talk to series creator Jamie Paglia, stars Colin Ferguson, Salli Richardson-Whitfield and Debrah Farentino at the recent Phoenix Comicon. They'll talk about what we've seen so far in season five as well as their thoughts on the beginning of the end of one of our favorite shows. If you're not caught up through last week's episode, "Worst Cast Scenario," we'll warn you that there are SPOILERS!
item.itunes:subtitle: If you're a fan of Eureka, you don't want to miss today's installment of Slice! Brian and Sam talk to series creator Jamie Paglia, stars Colin Ferguson, Salli Richardson-Whitfield and Debrah Farentino at the recent Phoenix Comicon. They'll talk abou[...]

item.title: Slice of SciFi #461: The Hoff vs Samuel L.
item.dc:creator: Michael Hickerson
item.description: Which 80's hit series could be headed to a theater near you? Trust us, you may not like the answer! Is the Hoff tough enough to take on the guy who stopped all those snakes on a plane?!? Did you get an invitation to the big Marvel wedding? These are just some of the questions we'll answer on today's installment of Slice of SciFi!

item.title: Slice of SciFi #460: Snow White and the Slicers
item.dc:creator: Michael Hickerson
item.description: It's Friday and that means it's time for a little Listener Feedback! This mean we'll comment on your comments about our comments. Yes, circular logic does make you dizzy, but at least there are no paradoxes like in time travel!

item.title: Slice of SciFi #459: R2D2 Caught Smoking With Drunk Aliens!
item.dc:creator: Michael Hickerson
item.description: Welcome to the mid-week installment of Slice of SciFi! On today's show, we'll take a trip down memory lane as R2D2 tries to kick his smoking habit and Captain Kirk warns us about pollution. It may sound a bit like a multi-verse segment from Lance, but it's a look at some 70's genre PSAs. Speaking of Lance, he's got a news update from the multi-verse, after a couple of messages from his sponsors, of course!

item.title: Slice of SciFi #458: Bat Jazz Hands
item.dc:creator: Michael Hickerson
item.description: Slice of SciFi #458: Bat Jazz Hands Watch the video edition of Slice of SciFi #458 Welcome to the latest installment of Slice of SciFi.  On today's show, we wonder if Ridley Scott has contracted sequel-itis, tell you some other places you can see the Dark Knight this summer, look at one of the summer's [...]
item.itunes:subtitle: Slice of SciFi #458: Bat Jazz Hands Watch the video edition of Slice of SciFi #458 Welcome to the latest installment of Slice of SciFi. On today's show, we wonder if Ridley Scott has contracted sequel-itis, tell you some other places you can see t[...]
item.itunes:summary:
Slice of SciFi #458: Bat Jazz Hands Watch the video edition of Slice of SciFi #458 Welcome to the latest installment of Slice of SciFi. On today's show, we wonder if Ridley Scott has contracted sequel-itis, tell you some other places you can see the Dark Knight this summer, look at one of the summer's biggest books and look into the future with Tom Cruise! Then it's time for a little deja vu with the latest trivia installment based around popular shows with time loops. And we've got a con report sponsored by the good folks at Geek Nation Tours. We'll be back Wednesday with more news and a trip down memory lane with some vintage genre PSAs!
Now You Can Watch Slice of SciFi!! Slice of SciFi TV is the place to watch all of your recent favorite episodes of Slice of SciFi: Slice of SciFi TV on YouTube http://www.youtube.com/user/farpointmedia Slice of SciFi TV: http://www.sliceofscifi.tv If you can't wait to watch, or if you can't wait to hear us on Sirius-XM, join the fun and watch us record the shows in studio -- LIVE!! Slice of SciFi TV live shows can be viewed every Thursday night, starting around 8pm Pacific (later start because of Daylight Savings time): Slice of SciFi: http://www.sliceofscifi.com/live/ Slice of SciFi TV: http://www.sliceofscifi.tv/live-show/ Justin TV: http://www.justin.tv/sliceofscifitv Listener comments: If you have questions or comments on any news items or scifi projects, or topics that are relevant to our favorite entertainment genre, Call our show and ask! You can leave your message at 206-339-TREK, and if your questions are brief and clear, or if your comments are fall-down funny, you just might hear them on the show! Go Social with Slice of SciFi Twitter: @sliceofscifi, @SliceofSciFiTV Google Plus: https://plus.google.com/113032745928846446855 Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/Sliceofscifi Shop: Kilt Wedgie Second Life:http://slurl.com/secondlife/Wind%20River%20Territory/50/129/22 Keep Slice of SciFi going and growing. Please donate and help us continue bringing you the best scifi and genre related news and entertainment available on the web and on Sirius-XM Radio. You can be a monthly contributor, or a one-time donation supporter -- either way, we thank you.
item.itunes:author: Michael, Brian, Sam and a cast of dozens

item.title: Slice of SciFi #457: Slicers in Black
item.dc:creator: Michael Hickerson
item.description: Slice of SciFi #457: Slicers in Black Watch the video edition of Slice of SciFi #457 Welcome to weekend-eve and the Friday installment of Slice of SciFi!    It's time for some listener feedback.  This mean we'll comment on your comments about our comments.  Yes, circular logic does make you dizzy, but at least there [...]
item.itunes:subtitle: Slice of SciFi #457: Slicers in Black Watch the video edition of Slice of SciFi #457 Welcome to weekend-eve and the Friday installment of Slice of SciFi! It's time for some listener feedback. This mean we'll comment on your comments about our[...]
item.itunes:summary:
Slice of SciFi #457: Slicers in Black Watch the video edition of Slice of SciFi #457 Welcome to weekend-eve and the Friday installment of Slice of SciFi! It's time for some listener feedback. This mean we'll comment on your comments about our comments. Yes, circular logic does make you dizzy, but at least there are no paradoxes like in time travel! We'll also catch up on the latest goings-on with Sweetleaf! Don't forget we'll be back Monday with a show jam packed with the latest news! See you then! So join the fun and call in with your questions and comments. Just call 206-339-TREK, that’s 206-339-8735. Make your comments short and unique or funny, and there's an excellent chance you will hear it on the show. We do want to hear your comments and feedback... No, really, we do! Just remember, any and every time the studio crew responds to the questions and comments posed by your voicemail submissions, you take a chance on hearing something about your favorite TV show or movie that you might not have wanted to know yet. HERE THERE BE SPOILERS!!
Now You Can Watch Slice of SciFi!! Slice of SciFi TV live shows can be viewed every Thursday night, starting around 8pm Pacific: Slice of SciFi: http://www.sliceofscifi.com/live/ Slice of SciFi TV: http://www.sliceofscifi.tv/live-show/ Justin TV: http://www.justin.tv/sliceofscifitv Go Social with Slice of SciFi Twitter: @sliceofscifi, @SliceofSciFiTV Google Plus: https://plus.google.com/113032745928846446855 Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/Sliceofscifi Shop: Kilt Wedgie Second Life: http://slurl.com/secondlife/Wind%20River%20Territory/50/129/22 Keep Slice of SciFi going and growing. item.title: Slice of SciFi #456: A Conversation with Salli Richardson-Whitfield, Star of "Eureka" and Phoenix Comicon Guest
item.dc:creator: Michael Hickerson
item.description: Welcome to the mid-week installment of Slice of SciFi! On today's show, we talk to Salli Richardson-Whitfield. You probably know her best from her role as Dr. Allison Blake on SyFy's Eureka. Salli is also a guest at the upcoming Phoenix Comicon, so if you're in the area why don't you stop by and say hello! And you can also catch some of the Slice crew there as well.

item.title: Slice of SciFi #455: Original Or Extra Radiation?
item.dc:creator: Michael Hickerson
item.description: It's Monday and that means it's time for some news, trivia and a con report! On today's installment, Joss Whedon thanks fans for the record-breaking opening to The Avengers, we've got a summer book recommendation and we wonder if the Hulk was pulled over in Connecticut. (Hulk speed!) Think you know the tag line to summer blockbusters? Kurt's here to test that with our latest trivia segment.
item.itunes:subtitle: It's Monday and that means it's time for some news, trivia and a con report! On today's installment, Joss Whedon thanks fans for the record-breaking opening to The Avengers, we've got a summer book recommendation and we wonder if the Hulk was pulle[...]

It's Monday and that means it's time for some news, trivia and a con report! On today's installment, Joss Whedon thanks fans for the record-breaking opening to The Avengers, we've got a summer book recommendation and we wonder if the Hulk was pulled over in Connecticut. (Hulk speed!)
Think you know the tag line to summer blockbusters? Kurt's here to test that with our latest trivia segment.

On today's show, we've got a familiar voice for animation fans, Phil LaMarr. LaMarr is the voice of Hermes on Futurama and you've heard him on [...]
item.itunes:subtitle: Slice of SciFi #453: An Interview With Actor Phil LaMarr, Phoenix Comic Con Guest Listen to or download the radio show It's time for the mid-week installment of Slice. On today's show, we've got a familiar voice for animation fans, Phil LaMarr. La[...]
item.itunes:summary:
Slice of SciFi #453: An Interview With Actor Phil LaMarr, Phoenix Comic Con Guest Listen to or download the radio show It's time for the mid-week installment of Slice. On today's show, we've got a familiar voice for animation fans, Phil LaMarr. LaMarr is the voice of Hermes on Futurama and you've heard him on a lot of other animated series. He's going to be part of the upcoming Phoenix Comic Con in a couple of weeks, so if you're out that way, why not drop by and see him? Of course, we've got the latest news from the multi-verse (wait until you hear what Lance has dreamed up this week!) and news from Flight Test Land. That doesn't even cover all the news we have to start off the show! And don't forget we'll be back Friday with our comments on your comments on our comments. See you then!

item.title: Slice of SciFi #452: Avengers, Avengers, Avengers (SPOILERS included)
item.dc:creator: Michael Hickerson
item.description: Welcome to the Monday installment of Slice of Sci-Fi. Kicking off the week, we've got a lot of talk about The Avengers, including a SPOILER within the first two minutes of the show. It's a pretty big one so if you haven't seen the movie yet and don't know details, you may want to fast forward a bit. (Consider this your friendly warning! And if you want to send hate mail to the source of the spoilers, that's tim@sliceofscifi.com)

item.title: Slice of SciFi #450: Talking With Casper Van Dien about "The Pact" and Phoenix Comicon
item.dc:creator: Michael Hickerson
item.description: Holy cow, it's our 450th episode! We'll celebrate with news about how one of our favorite shows could be coming back. Today's we interview actor Casper Van Dien from The Pact. Van Dien will also be a guest at the upcoming Phoenix Comicon, May 24-27 2012. We'll be back Friday with some listener feedback! See you then!

item.title: Slice of SciFi #449: News and Khan Report
item.dc:creator: Michael Hickerson
item.description: On today's show, we look at how Hulu is trying to keep you from cutting the cable, who the Batch is playing in the upcoming Trek film, the latest salvos in the e-reader wars and a public service announcement for our listeners.

item.title: Slice of SciFi #447: An Interview with William B. Davis, author of "Where There's Smoke"
item.dc:creator: Michael Hickerson
item.description: Welcome to the mid-week installment of Slice. On today's show, we talk to William B. Davis. Most of you probably know him best from his work on The X-Files as the Cigarette Smoking Man. Davis reflects on his time on the hit series and his career in theater, movies, radio and television in his new book Where There's Smoke...

item.title: Slice of SciFi #446: Take A Little Piece of Me
item.dc:creator: Michael Hickerson
item.description: The studio crew is back for a jam-packed Monday installment of Slice in which we discuss the possibility of mining asteroids for raw materials, the sonic screwdriver takes a step closer to reality and we fall more in love with Joss Whedon and Christopher Nolan. Kurt is back to stump us in trivia as well!

item.title: Slice of SciFi #444: An Interview With "Eureka" Producer Jaime Paglia

item.description: Welcome to the mid-week installment of Slice! Today we're talking to Eureka producer Jaime Paglia about the fifth season of the SyFy series. Be warned: if you haven't seen the season premiere, there are MAJOR SPOILERS here.

item.title: Slice of SciFi #443: Clowns are Even Scarier in 3D
item.dc:creator: Summer Brooks
item.description: The zombie apocalypse has hit the studio! Luckily, a couple of the Slice team survived and are here to bring you the latest news including the best explanation yet of why 3-D sucks, how the King of horror is revisiting his old horror grounds for an upcoming novel and how will Fringe end its season?
item.itunes:subtitle: The zombie apocalypse has hit the studio! Luckily, a couple of the Slice team survived and are here to bring you the latest news including the best explanation yet of why 3-D sucks, how the King of horror is revisiting his old horror grounds for an [...]
item.itunes:summary: The zombie apocalypse has hit the studio! Luckily, a couple of the Slice team survived and are here to bring you the latest news including the best explanation yet of why 3-D sucks, how the King of horror is revisiting his old horror grounds for an upcoming novel and how will Fringe end its season?
item.itunes:author: Michael, Brian, Sam and a cast of dozens

item.title: Slice of SciFi #442: Where are the MiG Flying Cars?
item.dc:creator: Michael Hickerson
item.description: It's that time again!  Yes, it's time for the Slice of SciFi crew to take your calls, answer your questions and debate your comments! So join the fun and call in with your questions and comments. Just call 206-339-TREK, that’s 206-339-8735. Make your comments short and unique or funny, and there's an excellent chance you will hear it on the show.

item.dc:creator: Michael Hickerson
item.description: Welcome to our mid-week installment of Slice. On today's installment, we talk to the cast of It's in the Blood, Sean Elliot, Scooter Downey and Rose Sirna.  Find out more about this new independent horror film in our interview and at their web site.
